body:
Not Sure why this is not showing build but all tests passed :- https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1670/2/artifact/yetus-general-check/output/patch-unit-phoenix-core.txt
@jpisaac
LGTM. The test case that failed before passes now (e.g., descending columns with LIKE x%).

awaiting QA build results https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1669/5/
Thank you @Divneet18 !

Thank you for the reviews @stoty @tkhurana @jinggou

Tanuj, sure let me add some test in `WhereOptimizerTest`, sounds good
done
@stoty @richardantal Could you please review this PR ?

There are a lot of test failures, which look relevant.
Please also check the checkstyle report (ignore the warnings for the existing lines)

> Looks good. @lokiore Need to handle the case for TTL=FOREVER. Previously NONE was supported, but we should support it going forward. Since HBase TTL spec does not allow it.

@jpisaac I have updated the PR to handle FOREVER and NONE value in both cases, when phoenix.table.level.ttl is enabled or disabled. Will create a JIRA to remove NONE value from TTL as it will require other changes as well and out of scope of this JIRA. Thanks!!!
LGTM +1 Thanks @lokiore
Thank you for the contribution @Divneet18!!
the build had test failures (not exactly relevant), triggered another run
@gjacoby126 does the latest revision look good to you?
Please rebase and squash @payert .

Sorry, I have already committed the previous version. 
No need to anything more.
Thanks, @virajjasani, I shall fix the indentation issues reported in the next patch.

Yeah i agree, i wish we could use public API directly, let me take some discussion to dev@hbase reg this. Scanning snapshot from client from restored region is valid usecase. While hbase supports it using ClientSideRegionScanner, it is also marked private. Moreover, even HRegion#initialize is deprecated, because the recommended way is to use HRegion#open directly, but that doesn't allow us to pass restored region flag.
build#1 timed out after 9+ hr, triggered new build: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1679/2/

@shahrs87 Refreshing live region servers in CQSI.init creates issues for the Permission related ITs. I have added a feature flag check in CQSI.init for now. We can look into those failing ITs as part of another sub-task to turn the feature on.
Test Report: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1666/17/testReport/
@Divneet18  Istvan is asking to change commit message (which is [here](https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1686/commits)). You changed the title and that is also required.
The phoenix-core tests are green, the phoenix-pherf tests are hanging (those are fixed in #1693 PHOENIX-7052)
fixed typo in the commit message
Unless there is any objections, let me merge this after 24 hr. Thank you @Divneet18!
@Divneet18 can you please create another PR against 5.1 branch?
no worries, i have done the cherry-pick @Divneet18, thanks again!
Looks like PTableType change from previous commit caused the conflict
looks good otherwise
FIxed the conflict and moved out the sqlline.py change.
Also make sure pylint passes

Some test failures reported with error:

```
ERROR 504 (42703): Undefined column. columnName=SYSTEM.CATALOG.CDC_INCLUDE
```
https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1681/5/testReport/

otherwise, we are good to go.
A useful change for debugging sqlline. Thanks @haridsv
@stoty  @tkhurana  @virajjasani  This PR is ready for review now. Can you please help review? Thank you.
Let me add TODO before merging this PR

Thanks for the review @shahrs87 .
As this code is only used for the old non globally consistent index implementation, and the bug comes from a copy-paste error in my refactor, I wouldn't spend a lot of time on writing a test for this.
@Divneet18  There are 615 test failures.  https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1697/2/testReport/

Also is there any way to mock the result set and return the mocked value and test the following scenarios.
1. start key is set but returned value is less than start key and the exception is thrown.
2. start key is set and returned value is equal to start key and the exception is NOT thrown.
3. stop key is specified but returned value is greater than stop key and the exception is thrown.
4. stop key is set and returned value is equal to stop key and the exception is NOT thrown.

@Divneet18
Test failures are relevant
Will need to revisit this, looks like we missed something fundamental here
This was just for running CI on 5.1

Now that i think about this Jira, we are adding O(1) time complexity for every single row returned so for large num of rows, this can turn out to be quite expensive, you are correct @dbwong.

@Divneet18 no worries, let's think about this and see whether we want to go forward with this change because the primary responsibility for returning the right results should stay within hbase scan and filter boundaries. Even though we check scan boundaries, what about filters? We can't introduce check for every single filter. This is going to be quite expensive.

@virajjasani Here is another case where it fails -

- When index is present on the view.

@ranganathg There are some test failures which look relevant. Can you please take a look ?
Thanks @jpisaac, this is taken care of in the latest revision.

This looks OK to me.
I will invite the community for review.

Can you rebase to the current master (unfortunately a few more rebases will likely be needed while the discussion is ongoing) ?
You may also want to squash the commits.

I see you haven't touched phoenix-client.
While the ultimate goal is to have a slimmer client, we plan to make a new artifact for that.
For now, phoenix-client should depend on phoenix-coprocessor, so it is basically unchanged.
Fixed Test failures.
@shahrs87 Lets wait for https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1702 before merging this PR.
@stoty I see the PR is closed but not merged. What do I need to get it merged?
It is merged, check the repo.
@palashc  The patch is ready to review now.
Will wait for jenkins build before merging.

I am in general very wary of overriding HBase properties from a Phoenix application, as this can very easily lead to failures for properties that must be in sync across the cluster for HBase to work.

In my ideal world we'd have some kind of whitelist for properties that are known to be safe to override (or an inverse blacklist)
(Of course users could still wreak havoc by modifying the hbase-site.xml used by the client)

I would tie the id propagation part to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-5974.
We could either correlate that single ID with the ConnectionInfo/profile (though it requires extra bookeepeing), or just add it alongside the query id.
Just opened a related [DISCUSS] thread on dev, @dbwong .
Test Report: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1666/31/testReport/

Overall the patch looks good. 
There are 7 test failures in RegexBulkLoadToolIT.
Along with test failures, there are asflicense, blanks, checkstyle and spotbugs warnings.
@palashc  Please take a look.
@shahrs87 RegexBulkLoadToolIT was probably a flapper. I have fixed most of the checkstyle and other issues.
Still there are 31 checkstyle warnings and 2 spotbugs warnings. Can you see if they are relevant?

I'll clean up the PR after tests are run.
Need to add more tests as well
Merged. Thank you @palashc  for working on this.

Need to rethink the approach here. Validating metadata on the write path in the `execute` phase might be too early since there can be arbitrary number of executes for different tables before client calls `commit` and we might end up creating mutations using old metadata.
Thank you so much @stoty
We match the ZK version from HBase.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
Triggered one more build: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1716/2/

The build failed with flacky test
Raised issue to analyze the same. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-7077
Build passed after retrigger.

Note that the HBase 2.1 build still fails with a netty version conflict that is caused by the very recent Omid 1.1.0 version bump.
However, this fixes the build with the older Omid version.

Thanks @virajjasani .
Unfortunately, we don't have precommit with HBase 2.1 , so the CI results are not relevant.

Thanks for the reviews and comments @stoty @ranganathg @dbwong @jpisaac 

I will go through comments and DISCUSS Thread today.
It seems we can't backport this to 5.1 because 5.1 does not have PHOENIX-6397
Thanks for the contribution @Divneet18, Thanks for the review @gjacoby126

https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1704/9/artifact/yetus-general-check/output/results-asflicense.txt
`ViewWhereValidationIT` needs ASF license.

spotbugs: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1704/9/artifact/yetus-general-check/output/new-spotbugs-phoenix-core.html

FYI, we are resuming this effort on https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1724
The latest revision has all tests passing
Can we add some negative testing? You can add a test coproc that returns a result outside the scan range.
@virajjasani  Thinking what changed from this PR https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1697 ?

> My main concern is this is too sfdc focused. A conection profile doesn't exist within the concept space of phoenix. I'd rebrand this as ConnectionInfo metrics. 

That's right. I have changed it to ConnecitonQueryService Metrics since this metrics are calculated at CQS Level. 

> My second concern is there apears to be a bunch of copy pasted or similar code... I opened a Jira for a better overall metrics infrastrucutre and while that is out of scope is it possiblegenericfy some of this.

That's right there are multiple class/code blocks which are copy pasted. I will add notes of these [PHOENIX-6174](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-6174) to simplify in future.

@dbwong
we need rebase

> I am in general very wary of overriding HBase properties from a Phoenix application, as this can very easily lead to failures for properties that must be in sync across the cluster for HBase to work.
> 
> In my ideal world we'd have some kind of whitelist for properties that are known to be safe to override (or an inverse blacklist)
> (Of course users could still wreak havoc by modifying the hbase-site.xml used by the client)
> 
> I would tie the id propagation part to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-5974.
> We could either correlate that single ID with the ConnectionInfo/profile (though it requires extra bookeepeing), or just add it alongside the query id.

`QUERY_SERVICE_NAME` config property is only for Phoenix Connection and for metrics related to CSQI. It won't be used anywhere in HBase layer. As far as I understand, [PHOENIX-5974](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-5974) is different from this JIRA and having a default name for CQSI Object.

@stoty

> FYI, we are resuming this effort on #1724 The latest revision has all tests passing

sorry for the confusion, i meant to create that PR (#1724) only to check how many cases need fixes at server side, so that PR was just meant to be the initial phase for correctly identifying problems, we can continue more work in this current PR.

Thank you for taking a look, @virajjasani .
I have rebased the patch.
Test failures are not related.

> overall good, if we could get review for HA changes, would be more helpful

Thank you.
I have pinged @dbwong , but he hasn't reacted yet. Can you reach him directly ?

And BTW this is something I'd also like to backport to 5.1.
While this is a new feature, itis meant to be fully backwards compatible, and if it is not, we need to fix that anyway.
No tests yet, I just want to see if this causes any regressions.

Thanks @stoty! 
I believe we might also need a heads up thread on dev@ to let everyone know of this big change getting committed to master and 5.1 branches?

> While this is a new feature, itis meant to be fully backwards compatible, and if it is not, we need to fix that anyway.

Makes sense, good candidate for 5.1.4 release
Sure, I will announce it, and copy the release notes to the email.

Create index on SYSTEM.CATALOG fails with the following exception. 
Note the SYSTEM.CATALOG exists and EXECUTE UPGRADE has already been called. I think some checks for index table creation is failing.

: jdbc:phoenix:localhost> CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS SYS_TABLE_TYPE_INDEX ON SYSTEM.CATALOG(TENANT_ID, TABLE_SCHEM, TABLE_NAME, TABLE_TYPE, VIEW_TYPE) WHERE TABLE_TYPE IS NOT NULL;
Error: Operation not allowed since cluster hasn't been upgraded. Call EXECUTE UPGRADE. (state=INT13,code=2011)
org.apache.phoenix.exception.UpgradeRequiredException: Operation not allowed since cluster hasn't been upgraded. Call EXECUTE UPGRADE.

Just for running the CI suite on the backport

> Create index on SYSTEM.CATALOG fails with the following exception. Note the SYSTEM.CATALOG exists and EXECUTE UPGRADE has already been called. I think some checks for index table creation is failing.
> 
> : jdbc:phoenix:localhost> CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS SYS_TABLE_TYPE_INDEX ON SYSTEM.CATALOG(TENANT_ID, TABLE_SCHEM, TABLE_NAME, TABLE_TYPE, VIEW_TYPE) WHERE TABLE_TYPE IS NOT NULL; Error: Operation not allowed since cluster hasn't been upgraded. Call EXECUTE UPGRADE. (state=INT13,code=2011) org.apache.phoenix.exception.UpgradeRequiredException: Operation not allowed since cluster hasn't been upgraded. Call EXECUTE UPGRADE. at org.apache.phoenix.query.ConnectionQueryServicesImpl.ensureTableCreated(ConnectionQueryServicesImpl.java:1553) at org.apache.phoenix.query.ConnectionQueryServicesImpl.createTable(ConnectionQueryServicesImpl.java:2118) at org.apache.phoenix.schema.MetaDataClient.createTableInternal(MetaDataClient.java:3056) at org.apache.phoenix.schema.MetaDataClient.createIndex(MetaDataClient.java:1557) at org.apache.phoenix.compile.CreateIndexCompiler$1.execute(CreateIndexCompiler.java:222) at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement$2.call(PhoenixStatement.java:559) at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement$2.call(PhoenixStatement.java:525) at org.apache.phoenix.call.CallRunner.run(CallRunner.java:53) at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement.executeMutation(PhoenixStatement.java:524) at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement.executeMutation(PhoenixStatement.java:512) at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement.execute(PhoenixStatement.java:2216) at sqlline.Commands.execute(Commands.java:814) at sqlline.Commands.sql(Commands.java:754) at sqlline.SqlLine.dispatch(SqlLine.java:646) at sqlline.SqlLine.begin(SqlLine.java:510) at sqlline.SqlLine.start(SqlLine.java:233) at sqlline.SqlLine.main(SqlLine.java:175)

I think this failure is not specific to partial indexes. I suggest that we fix it outside this PR.

```
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS S.T1(OID CHAR(15) NOT NULL,KP CHAR(3) NOT NULL, COL1 VARCHAR, CREATED_DATE DATE,CREATED_BY CHAR(15),LAST_UPDATE DATE,LAST_UPDATE_BY CHAR(15),SYSTEM_MODSTAMP DATE CONSTRAINT pk PRIMARY KEY (OID,KP)) MULTI_TENANT=true,COLUMN_ENCODED_BYTES=0;

CREATE VIEW IF NOT EXISTS S.G1_001(ID1 INTEGER not null,ID2 VARCHAR not null,ID3 INTEGER not null, ROW_ID CHAR(15) not null, COL2 VARCHAR CONSTRAINT pk PRIMARY KEY (ID1, ID2, ID3, ROW_ID)) AS SELECT * FROM S.T1 WHERE KP = '001';

CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS PI1_COL2_INDEX ON S.G1_001 (COL2) INCLUDE(ROW_ID, SYSTEM_MODSTAMP) WHERE COL2 IS NOT NULL;
```

Fails with the following exception -

0: jdbc:phoenix:localhost> CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS PI1_COL2_INDEX ON S.G1_001 (COL2) INCLUDE(ROW_ID, SYSTEM_MODSTAMP) WHERE COL2 IS NOT NULL;
Error: ERROR 1046 (43A03): Column updated in VIEW may not differ from value specified in WHERE clause. value='a' columnName=KP (state=43A03,code=1046)
java.sql.SQLException: ERROR 1046 (43A03): Column updated in VIEW may not differ from value specified in WHERE clause. value='a' columnName=KP
	at org.apache.phoenix.exception.SQLExceptionCode$Factory$1.newException(SQLExceptionCode.java:655)
	at org.apache.phoenix.exception.SQLExceptionInfo.buildException(SQLExceptionInfo.java:229)
	at org.apache.phoenix.compile.UpsertCompiler$UpsertValuesMutationPlan.execute(UpsertCompiler.java:1275)
	at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement$2.call(PhoenixStatement.java:559)
	at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement$2.call(PhoenixStatement.java:525)
	at org.apache.phoenix.call.CallRunner.run(CallRunner.java:53)
	at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement.executeMutation(PhoenixStatement.java:524)
	at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixStatement.executeMutation(PhoenixStatement.java:512)
	at org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixPreparedStatement.execute(PhoenixPreparedStatement.java:181)
	at org.apache.phoenix.compile.CreateIndexCompiler.verifyIndexWhere(CreateIndexCompiler.java:158)
	at org.apache.phoenix.compile.CreateIndexCompiler.compile(CreateIndexCompiler.java:195)
